item.title: Potion Dose Mixing
item.dc:creator: @k_a_h_leader Aeolian
item.description:
@k_a_h_leader wrote:

This works great.

I’m not specifying how to add it, figure it out it’s extremely easy.

Credits - Yarnova

public static final int potions[][] = { {229, 125, 123, 121, 2428}, {229, 6691, 6689, 6687, 6685}, {229, 179, 177, 175, 2446}, {229, 119, 117, 115, 113}, {229, 131, 129, 127, 2430}, {229, 137, 135, 133, 2432}, {229, 143, 141, 139, 2434}, {229, 149, 147, 145, 2436}, {229, 161, 159, 157, 2440}, {229, 3030, 3028, 3026, 3024}, {229, 167, 165, 163, 2442} };

potionLoop: for (int i2 = 0; i2 < potions.length; i2++) { for (int i3 = 1; i3 < potions[i2].length; i3++) { if (itemUsed == potions[i2][i3]) { for (int i4 = 1; i4 < potions[i2].length; i4++) { if (useWith == potions[i2][i4]) { int newDosage1 = 0; int newDosage2 = i3 + i4; if (newDosage2 >= potions[i2].length) { newDosage1 = (newDosage2) - (potions[i2].length - 1); newDosage2 = potions[i2].length - 1; } playerItems[itemUsedSlot] = potions[i2][newDosage1] + 1; playerItems[usedWithSlot] = potions[i2][newDosage2] + 1; resetItems(3214); break potionLoop; } } break potionLoop; } } }

Enjoy, this is better then a million lines of if-statements.

Read full topic
